2052.subject: BUS
2052.descrlong: Managerial accounting is the analysis of internal company costs, quality, and time, and making sound decisions based on this analysis such that the business runs efficiently. It requires second-guessing a company's internal accounting system, particularly in operations, and understanding what the numbers really mean. It includes creating internal accounting systems that serve the objectives of the company. Expertise in managerial accounting can make or break businesses, and make or break careers. Formerly MIE 205. (Offered every semester.)
